intro: Farsetia dhofarica, commonly known as the Dhofar farsetia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the southern region of Oman. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh desert conditions. Its limited distribution and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its restricted habitat, Farsetia dhofarica is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
